info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 16 at 3:36AM EST until January 16 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches with isolated amounts of up to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph will produce significant blowing and drifting snow Monday afternoon and evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero early this morning. * WHERE...Niagara, Orleans, Northern Erie, and Genesee counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 9 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Monday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 7 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult or even nearly impossible with deep snow cover on roads and very poor visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute Monday.
info.instruction: Widespread accumulating snow will create dangerous travel conditions. Submit snow reports through our website or social media. This is a potentially dangerous situation to be outdoors. If you must be outside, be sure to cover all exposed skin. Frostbite can occur in 30 minutes or less with apparent temperatures of 15 below zero or colder.
